enum.name: if_facer_opmode_t
enum.comment: This determines the current status of skill execution.
enum.item: Facer will not process any images
Facer will detect faces, but not try to recognize them.
Facer will detect faces, and then try to recognize the most dominant face.
Facer will gather images and learn an identity.

data.comment: The interface provides access to the face recognition plugin (facer). It provides basic status information about facer and allows for setting a specific mode and access the resolut. calling skills via messages. It can also be used to manually restart the Lua interpreter if something is wedged.
data.field: The number of identities in the database.
The index of the recognized identity.
The name of the recognized identity.
The identity that was recognized most prevalently.
The ratio of the most likely identity showing up in the history and the length of the history.
Time in seconds since the last successful detection.
The number of consecutive sighting ( <= 1 ) and non-sightings ( >= -1 ), respectively.
Indicates whether a new identity is currently learnt. If learning is in progress only "old" faces can be recognized.
Indicates the progress of recording images of a new face.
The relative bearing to the recognized face in radians.
The relative slope to the recognized face in radians.
Index of the identity for which the name was requested.

message.name: LearnFace
message.comment: Sets opmode to OPMODE_LEARNING and will assume the given label for the face.
message.field: The name assigned to the new identity.

message.name: SetName
message.comment: Assign a name to an identity.

message.name: GetName
message.comment: Upon receiving such a message the processing plugin should write the name corresponding to the given index into the "requested_name" field and the index into the field "requested_index".
